metadata.title: CVE-2023-3812 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s TUN/TAPdevice driver functionality in how a user generates a malicious (too big)networking packet when napi frags is enabled. This flaw allows a local userto crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-4.15.0-206-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-4.15.0-206-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-139-generic - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-139-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-139-lowlatency - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-139-generic - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-139-lowlatency - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1136-kvm - 4.15.0-1136.141
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1151-aws - 4.15.0-1151.164
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1096-aws - 5.4.0-1096.104~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-azure - 5.4.0-1103.109~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-gcp - 4.15.0-1146.162
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1100-gcp - 5.4.0-1100.109~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1044-ibm - 5.4.0-1044.49~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-206.217').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1136.141').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1151.164').
